intro: Cerastium glomeratum var. kotulae, commonly known as the Kotula's mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant features hairy, ovate leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern at the base. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and its role in local ecosystems.
